intro: Hippomarathrum bocconei, commonly known as the Boccone's balm, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrant properties.
